title: Jeremy Hunt's statement on the NHS and major incidents: Politics Live blog | Politics | The Guardian
summary: labour v tories on health - who 's winning ?
welsh government accuses cameron of making 'simplistic ' comparisons .
jeremy hunt 's statement on nhs major incidents guidance .
cameron announces afghanistan campaign memorial service .

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: michael fallon , the defence secretary , has said that the ministry of defence will have to continue to sell off land and equipment .
in a speech he said : the job 's far from over .
with continuing demands on our resources , with the cost of manpower and equipment rising , and with competition from emerging nations increasing efficiency in defence can not be a one-off .
as in any big organisation , mod must not merely be match-fit , it must be permanently fit .

every year we should be looking to take out unnecessary cost , to improve productivity , and to sweat our buildings and land so we can better support the front line we have got rid of old property we do n't need .
whether it 's an old barracks , a country house , some polo fields , the old war office or brompton road tube station sold for £ 53m .
that approach has generated sales of nearly £ 380m .
we 've taken the same tack with equipment , selling 123 surplus armoured vehicles to the latvian army and bringing in almost £ 40m and strengthening friendship with a critical nato ally .

now we need to ask more questions about our assets - do we need 57 separate sites within the m25 , how many airfields do we need , how many cars and vehicles do we need , and how do we go further in rationalising our defence estate ?
nicola sturgeon , scotland 's first minister , has said that she will personally take charge of any coalition talks about the general election .

at a briefing at westminster she said she would lead the talks , even though she is not and wo n't be an mp , and that alex salmond , the former leader who is standing for election , would have a part to play '' .
previously salmond has suggested that he would be the lead figure in these talks .

the institute for fiscal studies has produced a briefing note on the coalition 's welfare reforms saying , even after the end of the next parliament , universal credit still will not be fully implemented .
the introduction of universal credit - the replacement of a raft of means-tested benefits and tax credits with a new universal credit ( uc ) - is years behind schedule .
by now , all new claims were meant to be for uc and the transfer of existing benefit claimants to uc was meant to be well under way .
instead , problems with project management and it systems mean it is available to only some new claimants in a few parts of the country .
wider roll out is expected in the near future , but uc will still not be fully rolled out in april 2020 .
implementing the coalition government 's flagship welfare reform will therefore fall largely to the next government and the government after that ( if they choose to stick with it ) .
it also says the coalition 's reforms have been less radical than promised .
the reforms implemented so far largely represent an evolution of the system , rather than the revolution that was promised .
all the main benefits are still in place .

and although most benefits are less generous than in 2010 ( also shown in recent work by case ) , the cuts only partially reverse the increases in benefits and tax credits for low- and middle-income families with children and pensioners under labour : such families remain better off compared with an 'unreformed ' 1997 tax and benefit system ( although the same is not true for low-income working age adults without children who did not gain under labour 's benefit reforms , and have faced subsequent cuts ) - see figure 3.5 in our recent briefing note on the distributional impact of tax and benefit reforms .

harriet harman , the shadow culture secretary and labour deputy leader , has asked sajid javid , the culture secretary , to sack the tory peer lady noakes as deputy chair of ofcom for political bias .
( see 3.42pm . )

dafydd wigley , the former plaid cymru leader , has called on welsh people living in england to vote for the green party in the uk general election and green party supporters in wales to consider voting for his party .
that 's all from me .
thanks for the comments .

harriet harman kitwood/getty images harriet harman , the shadow culture secretary and deputy labour leader , has written to sajid javid , the culture secretary , asking him to sack lady noakes as deputy chair of ofcom .
noakes is a conservative peer .
ofcom is supposed to be impartial , and harman points out that when ed richards joined it , he resigned from the labour party .
but noakes is a conservative peer who has acted as a spokesperson for her party .
harman also points out that she has used her twitter feed to attack labour .
here 's an example from last week .
sheila noakes ( @ 1svn ) further fall in uk unemployment .
# longtermplan still delivering .
must not let labour back to destroy progress .

in her letter harman says : given the number of breaches of ofcom policy and the clear bias that baroness noakes has shown at a personal and professional level , i would ask that you reconsider baroness noakes ' position as deputy chair of ofcom as a matter of urgency .
the tories have produced a new election poster .
apparently , it is actually a real poster - it is going up on billboards - and not just a twitter one .
conservatives ( @ conservatives ) your worst nightmare just got even worse .
the snp & sinn fein propping up ed miliband = chaos for britain .
please rt .

the claim that labour are planning a coalition with sinn fein is based on this revelation from channel 4 news ' gary gibbon yesterday , which he wrote up in an excellent blog about what the minor parties think about going into coalition .
[ sinn fein ] do n't take up their seats in westminster .

but intriguingly i hear that has n't stopped labour shadow cabinet members wooing them and testing the water to see if they could be persuaded to sit in the commons if it helped to keep the tories out of power .
pat doherty mp tells me he is regularly badgered by labour shadow cabinet members on the question and he says he consistently replies that the republicans wo n't shift their position .
gibbon 's blog concludes that there probably wo n't be a formal coalition after the election , because the parties do n't like them .
but that did not stop the sun writing this up on its front page , in a story that starts : labour chiefs have held secret talks with sinn fein about forming a post-election coalition . ''

documents.title: hunt 's letter responding to burnham
text: jeremy hunt has written a letter replying to andy burnam ( pdf ) .
in it , he says he was not aware of the new guidance issued in the west midlands and that the improvement in a & e performance in recent weeks is due to the hard work of frontline staff .
it is therefore incredibly disappointing that once again you are seeking to undermine this hard work by implying that this improvement is due to other means .

documents.title: labour v tories on health - who 's winning ?
text: labour v tories on health - who 's winning ?

: today the morning news cycle ( news cycles used to last 24 hours - now it can be as short as 24 minutes ) , pmqs and the subsequent urgent question were all dominated by a row between labour and the conservatives over health , largely focusing on the west midlands major incidents guidance , but cascading to take in other issues too .
after five hours or so of this , who 's winning ?
labour 's key new attack line - the suggestion that jeremy hunt was effectively banning hospitals from declaring major incidents to prevent negative headlines ( see 10.50am ) - has collapsed .
hunt says this was nothing to do with him and no one has ( yet ? )
been able to prove otherwise .

andy burnham 's revelation that other guidance refers to political considerations being a factor when decisions about declaring major incidents are taken sounds a bit sinister ( see 1.07pm ) , but in reality is no more than an insight into the way nhs bureaucracies have always worked .
ed miliband had much stronger material when he revealed at pmqs that some a & e units that cameron specifically promised to save before the election have now closed .

but this punch got smothered by cameron 's retort about the quality of the nhs in wales ( where the welsh government , incidentally , is doing slightly a better job at defending its record than miliband - see 1.19pm ) .
but at least labour was attacking the government over substance .
cameron hit by resurrecting the weaponising '' row - a classic westminster insider concern that purely revolves around the appropriateness of a metaphor .

cameron 's indignation on this is entirely contrived ( i 've explained why before - it 's actually george osborne 's word ) and , as george eaton points out , the controversy is largely meaningless to people living in the real world .
george eaton ( @ georgeeaton ) it plays well in the house , but i doubt the average voter knows what `` weaponise '' means .

# pmqs cameron was on slightly stronger ground on wales , and up on andy burnham 's newsnight interview ( see 9.54am ) , and perhaps inspired by the person who is reputedly his favourite blogger , he tried to taunt miliband over the supposed inconsistencies in his health policy .
but this did not quite hit home either .
that leaves us , probably , with a messy draw .
but the very fact that we 've spent the morning about health , not the economy , is , in itself , a result for labour , for the obvious reason that health is a labour issue .
and , ultimately , substance matters much more than presentation , which is why i felt cameron 's weaponising charge was so feeble .
one person who has put this very well is nick robinson .

nick robinson ( @ bbcnickrobinson ) real nhs story is not who said what about it but who will do what to strengthen an nhs under real pressure in future # pmqs cameron spent half of pmqs effectively telling mps that robinson was the greatest journalist since richard dimbleby ( because robinson was the source of the weaponising '' story ) .
it 's ironic now that robinson has repayed him by exposing quite neatly the weakness in cameron 's line on health .

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: labour has forced the tories to spend the morning defending their record on the nhs .

ed miliband and andy burnham , his shadow health secretary , have criticised aspects of the nhs 's performance , while david cameron and jeremy hunt , the health secretary , have responded largely by accusing labour of trying to exploit health problems for political purposes .

the labour attacked primarily focused on new guidance issued to hospitals in the west midlands , which some nhs insiders believe is an attempt to stop hospitals declaring major incidents because they are politically embarrassing .

hunt brushed aside the charge rather successfully by saying that the decision had nothing to do with him , although burnham hit back in the commons by revealing separate guidance saying that political considerations are taken into consideration when these decisions are taken .
at pmqs ed miliband raised this issue , but also revealed that some a & e units that cameron had promised to defend at the 2010 election were now closed .

cameron focused on a matter of style and presentation , not substance , saying that miliband has now refused nine times to deny saying he wanted to weaponise '' the nhs , and urging him to apologise .
cameron said : you have now been asked nine times whether you made the disgraceful remarks about weaponising the nhs .
i think everyone in this house , and i suspect everyone in the country , knows you made those remarks .
so you should get up and apologise for this appalling remark and then we can take this debate forward .
miliband said that it was cameron who should apologise over the nhs , and he pointed out that cameron was quite happy to politicise the nhs in wales .
miliband said : frankly , this is a man whose got a war on wales and is using the welsh nhs to make political propaganda .
we know this prime minister is in a hole on the nhs and this is all he can offer the british people .
it 's time we had some answers from him .

cameron used the weaponising '' charge as his main attack line against miliband but towards the end of the exchanges , alluding to burnham 's interview on newsnight last night ( see 9.54am ) , cameron made a wider point about labour 's health policy .
a week ago the shadow chancellor said that every penny from their new homes tax would go into the nhs .
yesterday , the leader of the labour party said he had a plan to pay down the deficit with tax changes like the mansion tax we 've announced .
so there we have it : 99 days to go before the election and they ca n't even have a sensible policy on the nhs .
what a completely useless opposition .
cameron has annoucend that a service of commemoration will be held at st paul 's cathedral on march 13 to mark the end of the combat mission in afghanistan .
theresa may , the home secretary , has announced that victims may be able to report non-emergency crimes online in an effort to make reporting offences easier .

the home office , which is working on a prototype with the surrey and sussex police forces , believes it could help save an estimated 180,000 officer hours a year and around 3.7 million , if adopted by all forces .

in a speech may said : the growth in the internet has transformed other services - from shopping to banking - and it is right to give victims and witnesses greater choice over how they report issues to the police early estimates suggest online reporting could save forces an estimated 180,000 officer hours a year and around £ 3.7m .

the head of the local government association , david sparks , has described social care funding in england and wales as being in a ridiculous situation '' as councils are having to cut key services to fund care for the elderly .
lord wigley , the former plaid cymru leader , has apologised for comparing the trident base in scotland to auschwitz concentration camp .
tim reid ( @ timreidbbc ) statement from wigley : sorry if my remarks were open to any misinterpretation and i apologise for any offence that has been caused. ``
sir michael wilshaw , the head of ofsted , has rejected claims that ofsted unfairly targets christian schools .
when he was asked at the education committee if he had it in for christian schools , he replied absolutely not .
we 're going in to schools in birmingham , in bradford , in luton , in tower hamlets with children from a predominantly asian heritage who are predominantly muslim .
we 're failing those schools , we 're putting them in special measures .
here 's the statement from dr barbara hakin , national director of commissioning operatoins for nhs england , about the new major incidents guidance issued in the west midlands .

local hospitals continue to have responsibility for deciding whether to declare major incidents , but before doing so best practice dictates that they take account of the wider impacts on other parts of the nhs so that patient safety in the round is protected .
that 's why nhs england 's local area team in the west midlands decided to issue these guidelines .
this was not a decision of the department of health .

documents.title: welsh government accuses cameron of making 'simplistic ' comparisons
text: in response to what david cameron was saying about the welsh nhs at pmqs , the welsh government has put out a statement saying that a nuffield trust report said it was a mistake to compare wales with england .
the nuffield report said : the welsh population is older , sicker and has more deprivation than the population of england .
all these factors affect people 's health and therefore mean greater demands on the welsh health service .
any comparisons need to take this into account .
there is also an inherent unfairness in comparing performance for a population of three million with that for one of 54 million .
according to the welsh government , the nuffield report made two other points .

the overall conclusion was that performance across all four countries had improved at more or less similar rates over the 2000s as a result of the huge boost in funding when government investment in the nhs doubled in cash terms in all countries .
no one country consistently lagged behind or outperformed another , once relative starting points were taken into account .
a foreigner would be much more struck by the similarities than the differences .
and a welsh government spokesperson issued this statement .
this report confirms once again that simplistic comparisons between the nhs in wales and england are not fit for purpose .
it says there is an inherent unfairness in comparing performance for a population of three million with that for 54 million , especially as wales has an older and underlying sicker population .
it shows there has been improved performance in all the health services of the uk in recent years , but all nations face increasing demand .
the nuffield trust highlights once again that wales spends more per head on health when compared to england .
this is despite a £ 1.4bn cut to the welsh budget from the uk government since 2010 , and the fact the barnett formula does not take into account the welsh population 's needs .
the nhs in wales is performing better now than it was in 1999 , more people are being seen every day , more people are living longer thanks to the help they receive .
however , there are still areas where improvements must still be made .
in his response to hunt , andy burnham quoted from some nhs guidance on major incidents .
this is not the new west midlands guidance , but previous guidance covering what to take into account when deciding whether to declare a major incident .
it shows that political considerations are a factor .
here is the key passage .
politics a .
is there increasing involvement of senior command and control tiers , political involvement or excessive media coverage ?
b .
is there a requirement to bolster or assure public confidence c. is there a risk of reputational damage ?
barry sheerman , a labour mp , says it is his job , as an opposition mp , to weaponise '' the nhs , to use it as a weapon , and to expose the government policies that are destroying the nhs '' .
hunt says it is a shame that too many labour mps think like this .
nhs staff do not want the service used in this way , he says .
labour 's gisela stuart says she has , according to some figures , more medics in her constituency than anyone else .
she knows that doctors in the west midlands do not interpret the guidance in the way hunt interprets it .
they think they are being stopped from declaring major incidents .
hunt says hospitals should always decide what to do on sound clinical grounds .
sarah wollaston , the conservative chair of the health committee , asks hunt if he agrees that politicians should not get involved in operational decisions .
hunt says he agrees .
labour should stop trying to make political points .
hunt is responding to burnham .
in his desperate desire to weaponise the nhs , burnham has put politics ahead of patient safety , hunt says .
he says , under burnham , news management and political considerations prevented the government properly dealing with the mid-staffs scandal .
is burnham saying nhs england should not talk to local trusts ?
there are fewer major incidents because a & e performance has got better .
and this week figures have come out showing patient satisfaction has gone up .
where labour runs the nhs , there double the number of people waiting for operations and ambulances ?
has n't burnham shown that labour is not fit to run the nhs ?
burnham is responding .
he quotes from guidelines saying nhs england has to approve a decision to declare a major incident .
so these decisions are not purely local , he says .
he quotes from an email sent by head of operations at one trust .
he said the new guidelines in the west midlands were designed to stop people declaring major incidents .
is hunt satisfied that this guidance is clinically appropriate ?
he reads from separate guidance issued in the west midlands .
it includes a paragraph saying politics , and the risk of reputational damage , are factors to take into account ?
will hunt instruct nhs england to withdraw that guidance ?
andy burnham tv update at 1.07pm : the guidance that burnham was quoting from was not the new guidance , but earlier guidance .
i 've have clarified this above .
see 1.07pm for more .

documents.title: jeremy hunt 's statement on nhs major incidents guidance .
text: andy burnham , the shadow health secretary , asks his urgent question about the west midlands major incidents guidance .
jeremy hunt , the health secretary , says he is happy to come to the commons to discuss health policy .
but now he is here to discuss local guidance .
this is part of labour 's campaign to weaponise the nhs .
the document referred to by burnham was produced by the nhs in west midlands .
nhs england 's chief operating officer has said this was as local decision , and that it had nothing to do with ministers .
jeremy hunt parliament
andrew jones , a conservative , says cancer survival rates are getting better .
cameron says there is a 50 % increase in cancer referrals .
the cancer drugs fund has helped to .
that 's it .
pmqs has overrun by eight minutes .
that must be close to a record .
cameron says the government is dealing with a debt crisis left by labour .
jeremy corbyn , the labour mp , asks if cameron will ensure the greeks get the debt write-off they want .
cameron says he has spoken to the new greek prime minster .
he asked him what his long-term economic plan was .
in greece they have had repeated economic failures .
he hopes good sense prevails .
he told the greek prime minister that britain has led the world on tax transparency , and that britain could help the greeks ensure firms pay tax .

documents.title: cameron announces afghanistan campaign memorial service
text: richard drax , a conservative , asks if cameron backs the idea of a commemorative event to mark the contribution made by those who served in afghanistan .
cameron says on 13 march there will be a special service in st paul 's cathedral , and a parade , to mark the contribution made by those who fought there .
cameron says an enormous investment in aircraft carriers is helping workers on the clyde .
rob merrick ( @ rob merrick ) only new twist at # pmqs was seeing miliband so worked up for first time he was either `` passionate '' or `` flustered '' ( take your
labour 's clive efford asks cameron to comment on yesterday 's lse report showing that poorest have been hit the most by the coalition 's policy decisions .
cameron ignores the question , and mentions job creation figures for efford 's constituency .
when did the labour party become the welfare party ?
julian huppert , the lib dem mp , says labour 's decision to put the future of hinchingbrooke hospital out to tender was a failure .
will cameron ensure it stays in the nhs ?
cameron says it was labour 's decision to allow this hospital to be run by the private sector .
he thinks there is a role for the private sector .
but the private sector only accounts for 6 % of nhs work , up from 5 % under labour .
labour are in disarray .
andy burnham wants to limit the role of the private sector , liz kendall wants to expand it , and miliband wo n't confirm that burnham would be health secretary in his government .
unusually , cameron has received some backing from the mirror .
ampp3d ( @ ampp3d ) cameron is right about the poverty statistics # pmqs
cameron 's voice sounds very hoarse .
nicholas watt ( @ nicholaswatt ) will @ twitterid cameron 's voice last till end of pmqs
simon hart , a conservative , mentions a constituent waiting for bowel surgery in wales who would have been treated in england .
will cameron look into this ?
cameron says he will .
the labour administration in wales should be investing more in the nhs .
labour 's louise ellman says absolute poverty is up by 300,000 .
is cameron proud of his record ?
cameron says there are 600,000 fewer people in relative poverty .
and inequality is down .
more people are in work .
the labour party , of all parties , should support that .
tim yeo , a conservative , asks about the investment in science .
cameron says he is glad the government protected science investment .
the combination of science and universities is key to britain 's success , he says .

labour 's dennis skinner says if cameron wo n't apologise for a & e closures , perhaps he will apologise for having a record number of people using food banks , for people using payday loans , and for people on zero hours contracts ?
this pm has a longer record than his mate andy coulson .
cameron says the government has regulated zero hours contracts , and regulated the payday loan industry , an industry that boomed under labour .
he thought skinner would get nostalgic ; in the papers we have blairites fighting brownites , and mandelson taking out a huge loan .
cameron says the challenge fund set up by the government has increased access to gps .

snap pmqs verdict : cameron seemed to get the better response in the chamber , but the guardian 's phoney outrage detector went off the scale and exploded as he tried running the rather feeeble weaponise '' attack line again , which did him no credit at all .
miliband says last time the tories were in charge in wales people were waiting two years for operations .
he quotes an nhs figure saying hospitals in the west midlands are having their hands tied .
cameron says miliband is clutching at straws .
miliband is in a mess over wales .
labour ministers cut its budget .
a week ago ed balls said every penny from the new homes tax would go into the nhs .
but yesterday miliband said money from that would go to paying down the opposition .
what a useless opposition .
miliband says the nhs is in crisis and under strain .
no one will trust the government with the nhs ever again .
cameron says labour are casting around for a coalition with the snp , with sinn fein .
it would be a coalition of people who want to break up britain and those who want to bankrupt britain .
cameron says nick robinson , one of the country 's most respected journalists , said miliband talks in private about wanting to weaponise the nhs .
will he apologise ?
miliband says cameron is running away from the question .
he mentions another unit .
it is open or closed ?
cameron says his record on the nhs involves more money , and more doctors .
people want to know about miliband 's motives .
he should withdraw the word .
miliband says his motive is to rescue the nhs .
cameron has got a war on wales ; he is using the welsh nhs for political reasons .
everyone knows the pm is in a hole in the nhs .
he has broken his promise on waiting times .
can he explain why new guidance has been issued making it harder for hospitals to declare a new major incident .
cameron says the new guidance was issued by managers in the west midlands .
ministers were not involved , and nhs england said it did not come under political pressure .
yesterday miliband told the bbc that problems in wales should be compared with the past .
the ambulance response times in wales are now the worst in record .
will miliband admit that labour is to blame .
ed miliband says yesterday was an incredibly moving and emotional .
he thanks cameron for the work he has done on the holocaust commission report .
before the election cameron said he would have a bare-knuckle fight to save 29 a & e units .
how many are still open ?
cameron says miliband has now been asked nine times to confirm he talked about weaponsing the nhs .
we all know he said it.he should apologise .
miliband says it is cameron who should apologise .
he names three of those a & e units that are now closed .
why did he close them ?
cameron says he wants to ensure the holocaust is properly commemorated for years to come .
he , ed miliband and nick clegg were privileged to meet so many survivors yesterday .
labour 's lilian greenwood says her constituents say their number one concern is the nhs .
but it is at breaking point .
given that it is not one of cameron 's top priorities , should n't people vote labour .
cameron says this government decided to invest in the nhs , unlike labour .
in wales labour cut the nhs by 8 % .
and it is doing worse there , he says .
field says cameron should write to chilcot and get a date for the publication of the iraq inquiry report .
cameron says he has written to chilcot .
but it would not be right for the government to intervene , he says .
he says he first voted for an inquiry in 2006 .
the tories kept voting for it .
but labour were voting against it up until 2009 .
frank field , the labour mp , asks a closed question : when will cameron meet next sir john chilcot , and will he make a statement ?
david cameron says he has not plans to meet chilcot .
martyn brown ( @ martynexpress ) women on front bench - tories 8 v labour 8 # pmqs

documents.title: cameron and miliband at pmqs
text: pmqs starts in about 10 minutes .
if you wonder what 's the point , you 're in good company .
this is what ed miliband said about it at an event in belfast last week ( paywall ) .
watching me and david cameron shout at each other once a week on prime minister 's questions is n't very enlightening for anybody , let 's be frank about it .
it probably massively puts people off politics if they 're watching it because they think , 'it 's two blokes shouting at each other , what 's that got to do with my life ? '
someone in my office was telling me i 've done like 120-something prime minister 's questions in the last four years .
that 's sort of 120 times , a long time , that i 'm not going to get back in terms of my life .
you can read all today 's guardian politics stories here .
and all the politics stories filed yesterday , including some in today 's paper , are here .
as for the rest of the papers , here is the politicshome list of top 10 political must-reads , and here is the conservativehome round-up of today 's politics stories .
and here are four articles i found particularly interesting .
john hutton and alan milburn use an article in the financial times ( subscription ) to argue that labour should do more to defend the last government 's economic record .
it is understandable that the conservatives , under george osborne , the guileful chancellor , and lynton crosby , his election guru , should make this their mantra .
what is less understandable is that labour , under ed miliband and ed balls , his shadow chancellor , has been hesitant to rebut this charge .
they have worked harder to distance themselves from new labour than to defend its record .
this hands the tories a needless advantage .
if labour is to win in may , the two eds need to set the record straight and reclaim ground foolishly bequeathed to their opponents .
christopher hope in the daily telegraph says that up to 100 tory mps may rebel over plans to force cigarettes to be sold in plain packaging .
up to 100 tory mps are planning to vote against government plans to force tobacco companies to sell cigarettes in plain packaging , the telegraph can disclose .
in a move that will cause embarrassment for prime minister david cameron weeks ahead of the general election scores of conservative mps will vote against the plans .
there was widespread surprise last week when jane ellison , a junior health minister , said mps would be given a vote on whether to introduce plain packaging for cigarettes .
miss ellison said plain packaging was a proportionate and justified response '' because of the health risks associated with smoking .
any new plain packaging law would come into force in may 2016 .
the cabinet is understood to be split on the measure , with theresa may , the home secretary , and george osborne , the chancellor of the secretary , not forewarned about the plans .
james chapman in the daily mail says defence officials have started investigating the possibility of moving britain 's trident submarine base from scotland to wales .
sources have disclosed that work has now begun on the practicalities of shifting britain 's nuclear defence systems to pembrokeshire , should that prove necessary .
labour 's first minister in wales , carwyn jones , is understood to have indicated he would be prepared to see trident relocated to milford haven , a natural deep water port .
britain has four royal navy vanguard submarines , based at faslane , which can deploy trident ballistic missiles carrying nuclear warheads .
one well-placed source said political leaders in wales were keen for the ministry of defence to 'look at welsh sites - not just milford haven ' .
tom mctague in the mail says david lammy has said labour should not try to out-ukip ukip .
we 're getting an urgent question on the nhs major incidents guidance at 12.30pm .
labour whips ( @ labourwhips ) uq granted at 12.30 to @ twitterid to ask @ twitterid hunt what guidance has been issued by nhs england on declaring a major incident
in an earlier post i wrote up today 's polling figures , and flagged up what some of the experts trying to work out what those figures would mean on polling day are saying .
my colleague alberto nardelli has done his own number-crunching exercise for the guardian .
here are his figures .
guardian seat projection alberto 's methodology is broadly similar to may 2015 .

the elections etc and election forecast models are different , because they take current polling , but also adjust the figures in according with how they think the polls will shift before polling day ( based on historical data ) .

documents.title: hunt denies responsibility for major incidents guidance and hits back at burnham
text: jeremy hunt , the health secretary , has used twitter to say that ministers had nothing to do with the new major incidents guidance being issued in the west midlands .
( see 10.02am and 10.50am . )
he has accused andy burnham of cynically '' exploiting the nhs for political advantage .

jeremy hunt ( @ jeremy hunt ) 1/2 another day another example of labour trying to weaponise the nhs , this time on major incidents guidance jeremy hunt ( @ jeremy hunt ) 2/2 local operational decision in west mids which had nothing to do with ministers being cynically exploited by @ twitterid for politics .
he also ( predictably - see 10.14am ) had a go at the record of the nhs in wales .

jeremy hunt ( @ jeremy hunt ) today wales published worst ambulance response times since current records began , only 43 % of most urgent calls answered on time jeremy hunt ( @ jeremy hunt ) labour should focus on improving care for patients in wales instead of trying to score political points in england .

documents.title: burnham 's letter to hunt about major incidents guidance
text: andy burnham , the shadow health secretary , has now released the text of the letter he has sent to jeremy hunt , the health secretary , about the new nhs major incidents guidance .
he is asking a series of questions about how and why it was issued .
here 's an excerpt .

it has now been brought to my attention that new guidance was issued to some of england 's largest trusts in the west midlands area setting out the 'enhanced criteria ' , covering 17 detailed points , which must be met before a major incident can be declared .
it would appear from correspondence i have seen that this guidance was developed by an office of nhs england earlier this month and issued to ccgs shortly afterwards .
procedures for declaring major incidents are long-established in the nhs and it is a highly unusual move for new guidance to be issued in the middle of a difficult winter .
this had led some in the nhs to question the motives behind it .

i have been shown correspondence from nhs staff referring to the guidance , in which the head of operations at a major trust says : this is the enhanced criteria that have been introduced by nhs england ( to effectively stop trusts from calling a major incident ) .

worth sharing with the ed consultants as our hands will be tied in most cases if they wish to all a major incident for capacity reasons '' it is clear from the emails i have seen that clinicians and managers at the front-line have interpreted this guidance as a move to keep a & e pressures out of the news .
i am sure you will agree that is a worrying perception and will want to take steps to answer the questions i have set out as a matter of urgency .
michael fallon , the defence secretary , has delivered his speech this morning .
newsnight 's mark urban has this take .
mark urban ( @ markurban01 ) the mood music for uk defence is clear following fallon statement this morning that he can not guarantee budget .
expect further cuts .
and it seems that , if ministers are still looking for state assets to flog off , there are plenty of options left .
jonathan beale ( @ bealejonathan ) best factoid in fallon speech : the mod owns 15 golf courses !
# defence i 'll post a summary of the speech when i 've seen the text .
for the record , here are today 's yougov gb polling figures .

conservatives : 34 % ( no change from yougov yesterday ) labour : 33 % ( no change ) ukip : 14 % ( down 1 ) lib dems : 7 % ( up 1 ) greens : 7 % ( no change ) conservative lead : 1 point ( no change ) government approval : -23 yougov poll according to electoral calculus , this would leave labour the largest party , but five short of a majority .
and here are election predictions from a variety of organisations .

elections etc : conservatives 283 , labour 278 , snp 41 , lib dems 23 , ukip 3 election forecast : conservatives 284 , labour 282 , snp 33 , lib dems 27 , ukip 3 ( these are academic forecasts , based on models that using current polling data and make allowance for how polls shift in the run up to an election . )
may 2015 : conservatives 282 , labour 277 , snp 38 , lib dems 24 , ukip 6 ( this is based on current polling , taking into account lord ashcroft 's seat by seat polling . )
i think this is the first time since i have been posting these election forecasts here that all of them have pointed to the tories having the most seats .
it looks like we 'll be hearing about the welsh ambulance response times from david cameron at pmqs .
as the bbc reports , only 42.6 % of welsh ambulances met the eight-minute response target in december .
the bbc 's norman smith has now filed a full story on the new nhs guidelines in the west midlands tightening major incident criteria .
here 's an excerpt .

in an email exchange seen by the bbc , a head of operations at one nhs trust in the west midlands region says he believes the guidelines have been introduced to effectively stop trusts from calling a major incident '' .
he writes : this is the enhanced criteria that have been introduced by nhs england to effectively stop trusts from calling a major incident .
worth sharing with emergency department consultants as our hands will be tied in most cases if they wish to call a major incident for capacity reasons . ''
in the same email exchange , an a & e consultant says : it strikes me as an attempt to dampen down the heat and media attention on the emergency departments and their major incidents . ''

documents.title: andy burnham 's newsnight interview - verdict from twitter ( and me )
text: and , while we 're on the subject of andy burnham , there 's a lot of interest in his newsnight interview last night .
afterwards tories , and tory-inclined commentators , took to twitter to portray the interview as a disaster .
this is from tory hq .

cchq press office ( @ cchqpress ) watch : @ twitterid falls apart as his cynical scaremongering on the nhs is once again ripped apart this is from tim loughton , the conservative former children 's minister .

tim loughton mp ( @ timloughton ) burnham 's car crash newsnight interview referred 2 worthing hosp contract-shame he never showed interest when lab govt tried 2 downgrade it this is from david skelton , from the renewal uk pressure group .
david skelton ( @ djskelton ) glad to see burnham exposed as an opportunist over health reform on newsnight .
ca n't ignore his time as health secretary .
this is from iain dale , the broadcaster and former conservative candidate .
iain dale ( @ iaindale ) quite an astonishing interview on newsnight with andy burnham .
is this how labour thinks it will win ? !

# newsnight from ian birrell , the journalist and former david cameron speechwriter ian birrell ( @ ianbirrell ) burnham says coalition 'putting nhs up for sale ' when his govt gave twice as much nhs care to private providers .
such a hypocrite # newsnight from guido fawkes guido fawkes ( @ guidofawkes ) andy burnham condemns nhs outsourcing .
out of total 5.9 % , the first 4.4 % was done by burnham .
burnham was also criticised by two journalists better described as miliband-sceptic ( philip collins ) or miliband-hostile ( dan hodges ) .
philip collins ( @ pcollinstimes ) burnham puzzling .
if doctor judges private provider to be best option , is that ok ?
if it replaces public provider ?
dan hodges ( @ dpjhodges ) andy burnham in the mirror writes that labour will `` call time on the [ nhs ] market experiment '' .
on newsnight he said the opposite .
the problem arose because kirsty wark kept pressing burnham to explain how much private sector involvement in the nhs he would allow .
burnham 's reply - that it should play a supporting role , but that the growing expansion of the private sector should stop - struck me as perfectly reasonable , but perhaps i 'm a softy .
john prescott , the labour former deputy prime minister , defended burnham .
john prescott ( @ johnprescott ) must say i thought @ twitterid was very good on newsnight .

good to see our people speaking passionately about what they want to do and alun michael , the south wales police and crime commissioner and former labour minister , criticised wark for being unprofessional .
alun michael ( @ alunmichael ) @ andyburnhammp congrats on keeping your cool through newsnight interview that was unprofessional & sometimes rude .
keep on making the case !
i 'll leave the last word to the academic philip cowley .
as usual , he 's got a good point .
philip cowley ( @ philipjcowley ) a rule of modern politics : interviews are never as good or bad as everyone claimed on twitter when they were shown live .

documents.title: burnham demands explanation for new hospital major incidents guidance
text: in the west midlands new guidance has been issued to hospitals tightening the conditions that need to be met for them to declare major incidents .
norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) breaking the bbc has seen new guidelines issued to some hospitals in england over when they can call major incidents .
norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) senior source in west mids hospital says new guidelines designed to `` tie hands '' of trusts from declaring major incidents .
as you 'll remember , at the start of the year at least 15 hospitals in england declared major incidents when their a & e departments were being overwhelmed .
this is a procedure that allows managers to access extra resources .
andy burnham , the shadow health secretary , is worried that this is simply a pr move .

andy burnham ( @ andyburnhammp ) about to write to @ twitterid hunt to ask why `` enhanced criteria '' were introduced on nhs trusts declaring 'major incidents ' in middle of january andy burnham ( @ andyburnhammp ) senior nhs staff in the region interpreted it as a move that had more to do with news management than patient safety .
urgent answers needed .
according to the bbc , conservative councillors on west somerset council have passed a vote of no confidence in their local conservative mp , ian liddell-grainger .
but his local conservative association has backed him .
election campaigning ebbs and flows .
yesterday , with 100 days to go until polling day , the two main parties were in frenzied electioneering mode .
today it 's a bit calmer , although there is quite a lot of parliamentary business on the go .
here 's the agenda for the day .
9.30am : michael fallon , the defence secretary , gives a speech on selling off surplus mod land and equipment .
9.30am : sir michael wilshaw , head of ofsted , gives evidence to the commons education committee .
9.30am : mark harper , the disability minister , gives evidence to the commons work and pensions committee .
10am : theresa may , the home secretary , gives a a speech to the international police and crime conference .
10.15am : dafydd wigley , the former plaid cymru leader , holds a news conference on plaid 's election priorities .
10.30am : lord livingston , the trade minister , gives evidence to the commons business committee on ttip ( the transatlantic trade and investment partnership ) .
12pm : david cameron faces ed miliband at pmqs .
around 12.40pm : mps begin a debate on a labour motion on the nhs and the government 's spending cuts .
1.45pm : nicoal sturgeon , scotland 's first minister , holds a briefing at westminster on the snp 's european vision .
as usual , i will be also covering all the breaking political news from westminster , as well as bringing you the most interesting political comment and analysis from the web and from twitter .
i will post a summary at lunchtime and another in the afternoon .
if you want to follow me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .
